author: ngweihan_eth
content:
I think the right place to ask this question would be the `history-expiry` channel.

Actually, historical blocks are not needed at all for the latest block validation, it's only used in RPC requests or peer requests (see EIP4444). However, that's not to say that the entire network can just dump the historical data and just forget about it. It still needs to be available, for anyone and everyone to see what has happened in the history. At least, that's the foundational value of the Ethereum network.
